TextSection.Contents: A rare congenital laryngeal anomaly characterized by an abnormal dilation of the laryngeal saccule that is filled with air maintains communication with the laryngeal lumen and is either confined to the false vocal fold or extends upward protruding through the thyrohyoid membrane to the neck. Symptoms may include cough hoarseness stridor sore throat and uni- or bilateral swelling of the neck. Blockage of the laryngocele neck can result isn laryngomucocele and forms laryngopyocele when infected.
